title: The 28 best indie games on PC and consoles
text:
The 28 best indie games on PC and consoles The 28 best indie games on PC and consoles Some of the best games are made on smaller budgets Shares Introduction 
In 2017, it’s no longer the case that the biggest budgets make the best games. While major, triple-A game publishers tend to sell hype on recycled ideas, indie developers maintain the “retro” design strategy of crafting new, frankly unique experiences. 
Indie games tend to be distributed digitally, whether via game-specific marketplaces such as Steam, Origin and PSN or through third-party key sellers like Amazon and Gamestop. And now, with the Nintendo Switch in the open for the few lucky enough to find one in the wild, indie games are about to get even more pervasive. Why I love GDC, the most diverse games show on Earth 
By leveraging standout art styles – some cel-shaded, others 8- or 16-bit – indie games can strike distinct visual appeal without putting much strain on your hardware. This, in turn, makes indie games more accessible than their big-budget counterparts, making them effectively the antithesis to the classic “But, can it run Crysis?” jokes. 
For this list, we’ve carefully sorted through our favorite indie games of the past few years while supplying a single anticipated entry. Since we’re sure to miss a few, let us know in the comments below if we’ve overlooked one of the best indie games to play on your PC or console. 
Joe Osborne, Kane Fulton and Gabe Carey have also contributed to this article Prev
